result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark James Fossell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Plea hearing. State puts offer on record. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court, defendant Mark James Fossell not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Arguments heard by state and defense. For reasons stated on the record, Court takes no action on bail. All conditions remain the same. Discovery and global offer received. Defense requests more time to review offer with client. 5/27 scheduling conference remains set.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.
E-mailed parties to set up immediate bail review date. Defendant at HOC. Zoom appearance arranged with HOC by the clerk.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court, defendant Mark James Fossell not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense advises he has not receiced discovery and requests a scheduling date.  Defendant to be in person on the next date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court by video with Attorney Thomas J. Schneck who appears in person.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 22CF593. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: South Milwaukee Officer N. Siefert. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction received and filed.  bm

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court, defendant Mark James Fossell not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Bail Hearing.  State does not have victim notification and defense counsel advises Court that request for bail modification came at the request of the public defenders office.  Court will schedule this case after preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Payable Number: 999499,

Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with JAF (DOB 7/22/1975); DS (DOB 6/26/1971); OC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark James Fossell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request to be heard on bail.

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
